metadata.title: CVE-2023-52449 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mtd:Fix gluebi NULL pointer dereference caused by ftl notifier If both ftl.koand gluebi.ko are loaded, the notifier of ftl triggers NULL pointerdereference when trying to access ‘gluebi->desc’ in gluebi_read().ubi_gluebi_init ubi_register_volume_notifier ubi_enumerate_volumesubi_notify_all gluebi_notify nb->notifier_call() gluebi_createmtd_device_register mtd_device_parse_register add_mtd_deviceblktrans_notify_add not->add() ftl_add_mtd tr->add_mtd() scan_headermtd_read mtd_read_oob mtd_read_oob_std gluebi_read mtd->read() gluebi->desc- NULL Detailed reproduction information available at the Link [1], In thenormal case, obtain gluebi->desc in the gluebi_get_device(), and accessgluebi->desc in the gluebi_read(). However, gluebi_get_device() is notexecuted in advance in the ftl_add_mtd() process, which leads to NULLpointer dereference. The solution for the gluebi module is to run jffs2 onthe UBI volume without considering working with ftl or mtdblock [2].Therefore, this problem can be avoided by preventing gluebi from creatingthe mtdblock device after creating mtd partition of the type MTD_UBIVOLUME.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-lowlatency - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-kvm - 4.4.0-1135.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1172-aws - 4.4.0-1172.187
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-aws - 4.15.0-1170.183~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1179-azure - 4.15.0-1179.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1164-gcp - 4.15.0-1164.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-oracle - 4.15.0-1133.144~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-257.291').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.145').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1172.187').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.183~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1179.194~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1103.110').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1164.181~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.144~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
